Articles.Content:
Basically the user above you will post [insert good result] but [insert some downside] and you must reply if you would push the button that make it happen and explain why or why not.

(if you need insperation for what to ask go here)

example:

Post 1: You can go to equestria but it is the fandom equestria.

Post 2: I would push the button because [insert reason if you want]

I'll start

You can go to equestria but it is the fandom equestria

Edited November 8, 2013 by briansun1

Dude, it's totaly what I wanted, those silly ponies are boring without THE factory and THOSE rainbow-flavored cupcakes.

You have a portal gun, but I have 5% chance to teleport you in a random location in the universe. (Space, volcano, stars, etc.)

I would push it because 5% seems a bit on the low side so yea why not

you will save the world for the apocalypse but your blamed for starting it and never get the credit for fixing it.

I would push it. Nobody said I would be punished, so no point in not doing so!

You might get immortality, or it will explode. 50/50.

i'd not push it. both eternal life on earth and death are pretty bad.

Push the button, you get a lifetime supply of cheesecakes but your house will constantly have vampire bats living in it

I'd not push it, since I don't even like cheesecake.

Push the BIG RED button. Gives you 0.26 tomorrow, or erases every save you currently have: 50/50 chances.

yes, I mean if my saves got erased I wouldn't really care the risks far outweigh the rewards.

Push the button, You gain super intelligence, or suffer severe brain damage 50/50 chance.

Unneeded. Nope, do not press.

Push the button to gain immortality, but it cannot be undone.

I would not push the button, I mean... being alive... forever, is cool... but it's like "i'm bored of life".

If you push the button you get cake. But the cake may be a lie. 50/50 chance.

I would push the button and hope for the best.

Push the button for a 50% chance to win $1,000,000 or lose everything you have.

Too much of a contrast between good and bad. So yeah, not pressing it.

If you press this button, you will meet Jebediah Kerman, but he and you are sent on a DANGEROUS mission to Laythe, then Jebediah falls out of the rocket and the lander breaks when you're descending. Then you'll be stranded, FOREVER.

Edited November 9, 2013 by CombustibleSanic

Presses button. Jeb. Laythe.. they will come out for me... someday.. right?

If you press this button it will turn into a horse. But in 1 day it will turn into a MLP pony.

I press button after moving it to a secure underground bunker.

Press button for univers restart?

Yeah! press it! (after a backup, for sure)

You can have a "That was easy" button that have 50/50 chance to save the situation or destroy it.

"Press the button!" "Don't press the button!" "Yes! Press the button!" "NO, I forbid you to press that button!"

I'd rather not. I don't know what the "situation" is.

The button is a stalemate resolution button. You stop GLaDOS from killing you and put him in charge of the nuclear reactor.

Nope. I always beat GLaDOS anyway, and besides, that little punk is always more trouble than he's worth.

Push the button for free candy. 10% chance of a completely random effect -- anything in the known universe, both within and outside of your imagination.

I press it! in the whole universe, there's a uncalculable chance that the said event affect me.

Press the button to break the fourth wall, for the good and the bad...

Better not. Might have some odd effects, like some actors suddenly having real super powers. You just never know.

Push the button to push the button, but you might not actually end up pushing the button.

No. Yes. Maybe? I hate paradoxes.

If you press it, you become all-knowing, but would only live for 24 hours.

Nope. I can do anything without being all-knowing. But 24 hours? Serious deal breaker.

Push the button to instantly resolve all paradoxes, but at the cost of your life.

I will not push the button. Paradoxes are fun!

Push the button to get into space but with only 3 minutes of oxygen left and 2 km away from ISS.

Are you kidding me? a docking procedure that more that 3 min, and how did I will go the ISS?

Push the button to end the humain civilisation and reborn as a random extraterestrial at a rendom time and space.

Backs away from the button very very slowly.

Push the button for a cake, 25% a lit SRB comes out.

That's terrible odds, who would want to push a button that has a 75% chance of failure?

Push the button and you will be reborn as a fairy in Pixie Hollow, with all the perks and drawbacks of being a fairy.

i would push and hope for the best because everything i have i think my life counts for that too i won't be without everything for long any way

push the button for a 50/50 chance of starting nuclear war or world peace
